content: The "Charitable Giving Partnership Act" may be cited as the short title of this Act. Eligible activities are outlined in Section 2. Section 105(a) of the Housing and Community Development Act of 1974 is amended to allow for payments to states to supplant general revenue losses incurred under state laws providing tax credits for contributions to certain tax-exempt organizations. The curr_chunk discusses the criteria for organizations to qualify for certain tax benefits under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, including being organized in the US or a qualified state, filing returns under section 6033, and primarily providing services to individuals with low incomes or temporary donations of food. The curr_chunk outlines the requirements for organizations to qualify for tax benefits, including providing direct services to individuals with low incomes or temporary shelter to homeless individuals. Additionally, it states that all annual expenditures must be used for direct services, with a maximum of 10% allowed for administrative or fundraising purposes. The curr_chunk specifies that organizations must not engage in activities like influencing legislation or political organizing to qualify for tax benefits.
